GDP of Sri Lanka which was 89 USD Billion in 2019 dropped to 74 USD Billion in 2022 and is expected to reach 76.86 USD Billion by the end of 2024. Do you know how the GDP is calculated? GDP = private consumption + gross private investment + government investment + government spending + (exports â€“ imports). GDP is usually calculated by the national statistical agency of the country following the international standard.

GDP data for 2023 is out and Sri Lanka overall clocked in a 2.3% contraction. However, in the final quarter the economy saw is largest quarterly growth at 4.5% for the 3 months to Decemebr 2023. This was driven by an expanding industrial sector at 7.8%, lower interest rates, and the significant influx of tourists to the island. The December quarter growth is promising for 2024. With my prediction for interest rates to keep dropping from the second quarter onwards to increase investment and interest induced consumption, and the expectation of drawing 4.5mn tourists for the year, we could expect to see Sri Lankaâ€™s economy record a positive GDP growth for 2024 between 1.5%-3% with inflation between 5%-7%.
